main.description: currently employed by Amazon, where I work within the Prime Video Organization. Take a look around my website to learn more about my work and interests
main.bio: As a Software Development Engineer within the Prime Video Organization at Amazon, I have tackled numerous challenging and innovative projects since joining the company in November 2020. Prior to this, I was working as a Software Engineer II at Abrigo, an Enterprise Risk Management software company in Raleigh, NC. I view myself as a lifelong learner, and recently earned my AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate certification. I am passionate about leveraging my skills to enhance people's daily lives. Let's connect!

resume.skillmessage: I have been able to work with a diverse range of technologies and programming languages, and I am always eager to expand my skillset. Below are some of the tools and languages that I have found particularly enjoyable to work with over the years.

education.school: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
education.degree: BS, Computer Science | BSPH, Biostatistics | Minor, Mathematics
education.description: During my undergraduate education at UNC, I gained a foundational understanding of the theory behind data structures, algorithms, web development, and databases. Additionally, my pursuits in Biostatistics and Mathematics helped me gain experience in advanced statistical computation and problem solving.

work.title: Software Development Engineer
work.description: Currently, I work at Amazon as a Software Development Engineer within the Prime Video organization. My tenure at Amazon has provided me with numerous opportunities to work on diverse and challenging projects. I served as a team lead on one project, which involved building a new Top 10 service responsible for generating Top 10 Carousels on the Prime Video Storefront. Additionally, I worked on an initiative to implement a new search mechanism that significantly improved the accuracy of relevant titles on Genre-based storefront pages. During my time at Amazon, I have honed my skills in an array of technologies, including Java, React, and various AWS cloud services such as S3, DynamoDB, Lambda, CDK, CloudWatch, Athena, and QuickSight.

work.title: Software Engineer II
work.description: I worked at Abrigo as a Software Engineer II on the Risk team.  I was involved in various full stack projects and had the opportunity to program a new methodology for calculating loan probability of default. Throughout my time at Abrigo, I regularly used a plethora of technologies such as SQL Server Management Studio, NHibernate, C#, .NET Framework, AngularJS, HTML, CSS, and Git.

work.title: Software Development Intern
work.description: I worked as a Software Development Intern for the Customer Intelligence team at SAS. During my time here, I had the opportunity to work on an exciting cloud-based project. My work involved developing an end-to-end automation of content creation and delivery in SAS Customer Intelligence 360, the SAS Marketing Software, utilizing an internal REST API using Java. Additionally, I used SAS Programming to manage and display the generated data for the marketing team.

work.title: Year-Round Technical Intern
work.description: I started off working at SAS as a Year-Round Technical Intern in Technical Support. Along with providing customer support for the SAS Analytics U products, I was able to gain experience in Software Engineering. Using C#, I was able to create a system requirements checker for customers to run on their machines, which addressed the most common problem that our customer base faced. It was through this project that I discovered my passion for Software Engineering.

work.title: Statistical Analyst
work.description: I worked as a Statistical Analyst in the Department of Anesthesiology, as part of a research team. The research was centered around studying the microRNA of patients that had chronic widespread pain and post-traumatic stress disorder, with the goal of identifying markers on the microRNA that contributed towards sex-dependant differences in this pain. I used SAS Programming in order to analyze the data and generate reports and charts that displayed results of the research.

skills.name: AWS
skills.description: At Amazon, I gained experience with AWS technologies including S3, Lambda, and CloudWatch. I obtained the AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate certification to expand my AWS expertise, and am eager to apply this knowledge in future projects.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: I learned Java as my first programming language and used it extensively throughout college and at Amazon, where it is the backbone of our backend programming. Java's robustness and scalability make it an ideal choice for enterprise-level applications.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: I've used Python extensively at Amazon and on personal projects, from task automation to data analytics. With its powerful versatility and straightforward syntax, Python is a pleasure to work with. I look forward to exploring its capabilities further in future projects.

skills.name: C#
skills.description: At Abrigo, I used C# and the .NET Framework as the primary backend technologies for various projects and enhancements. C# is an excellent language for building scalable and efficient applications, and I enjoyed working with it to develop robust and reliable solutions.

skills.name: React
skills.description: I gained experience with React through personal projects and at Amazon, where it is our primary frontend framework. Its component-based architecture is intuitive and efficient, making it one of my preferred frameworks for web development. I look forward to using it in future projects.

skills.name: AngularJS
skills.description: At Abrigo, I had the opportunity to work with AngularJS as our primary front-end framework. Despite having no prior work experience in front-end development, I quickly grew comfortable using AngularJS to develop complex and dynamic web applications.

skills.name: Microsoft SQL Server
skills.description: During my time at Abrigo, I used Microsoft SQL Server as our relational database management system. I have also enjoyed using MongoDB for my personal projects due to its simplicity and quick setup.

skills.name: SAS
skills.description: I gained experience in SAS through my Biostatistics major and further developed my skills during my internship at SAS Institute. My proficiency in SAS allowed me to obtain my Base Programmer certification and collaborate on a research project that was later published by SAS.

projectList.title: Exercise Tracker
projectList.category: A Full Stack MERN based Exercise Tacking Web App (In MVP Stage)

projectList.title: Shopping List
projectList.category: A Full Stack MERN based Shopping List Web App (In MVP Stage)

projectList.title: Personal Portfolio
projectList.category: A React based Personal Portfolio Website

otherInterests.generalInterests: Aside from my love for coding and problem-solving, I enjoy refining my photography skills and capturing my travels through my lens. While my photography portfolio is a work in progress, I'm excited to share it here in the future. In addition, I am also passionate about all things sports, whether that means playing, watching, or analyzing sports statistics.
otherInterests.danceInformationPart1: As a former member of two competitive dance teams, UNC Bhangra Elite and UNC Chalkaa, I traveled the country and competed against some of the most talented teams in the dance circuit. In 2017, UNC Chalkaa finished in the top 10 nationally and received an invitation to compete at the National Championship in California.
otherInterests.danceInformationPart2: Nowadays, I continue to pursue my passion for dance by attending various workshops and classes in New York City, where I have the opportunity to learn and grow as a dancer.
